section.title: Overview
section.p: Emergency calls arrive to the PCRF over both the Gx and the Rx interfaces. The Gx interface may identify the call as emergency through its APN and the Rx side has a AVP that can be used to indicate emergency calls. The emergency calls are always connected.

ul.li: Verify the CCR-I initial request comes towards PCRF from PGW.
Verify successfully PCC Rule is Installed on Gx Interface for Emergency Session for both Gx and Rx Session.
Verify PCRF installed the PCC rule and assign the Two Dedicated Bearer for IP-CAN and Install the AF rule based on the AF reporting.

section.title: Provisioning

note.p: Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.

section.p: Pre-condition: Verify that the basic provisioning is done for Gx and Rx at NCC.

ol.li:
Configure the APN for emergency calls. To do this, log into the SM GUI and navigate to Policy & Charging and click the Policy tab. Select the APN Configurations from the drop-down list. Click to configure the APN.
For Gx, LTE is configured and for Rx, IMS is configured. For Gx calls, the Called-Station-ID comes as LTE and for Rx calls, the service URN is the AVP which indicates the value of IMS.

Create the PCC rule template using Gx policy RSV rule group. To do this, log in to the SM GUI and navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Policy tab. Select the Network Rule Templates from the drop-down list. Click to create the rule templates as shown in the following figure:
EmergencyRule1 is predefined template.
Define the condition in IP-CAN Establishment rule based on Emergency APN.
Define the condition for AF SESSION Establishment for the definition of the PCC Rule for Volte.
Create the device E.164. To do this, navigate to Subscriber Manager and select the Devices tab. Click to create the device.
